009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D65;
014
015import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
016
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This class implements the sRGBcolor space with D65 white point. See Sec. 14.4
023 * of [1] for details. Components of all {@code float[]} colors are supposed to
024 * be in [0,1]. This is a singleton class with no public constructors, use
025 * {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
029 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
030 * </p>
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/11/14
034 * @see LinearRgb65ColorSpace
035 */
036@SuppressWarnings("serial")
037public class sRgbColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion, RgbPrimaries {
038        
039        // chromatic adaptation objects:
040        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
041        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
042        private static final GammaMappingFunction GammaMap = GammaMappingFunction.sRGB;
043        
044        private static final sRgbColorSpace instance = new sRgbColorSpace();
045        
046        public static sRgbColorSpace getInstance() {
047                return instance;
048        }
049        
050        /** Matrix for conversion from XYZ to linear RGB. Its column vectors are the 
051         * XYZ coordinates of the RGB primaries. */
052        private static final double[][] Mrgbi = 
053                {{0.412453, 0.357580, 0.180423},
054                 {0.212671, 0.715160, 0.072169},
055                 {0.019334, 0.119193, 0.950227}};
056        private static final float[][] MrgbiF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgbi);
057        
058        /** Matrix for conversion from linear RGB to XYZ (inverse of {@link #Mrgbi}). */
059        private static final double[][] Mrgb = Matrix.inverse(Mrgbi);
060        private static final float[][] MrgbF = Matrix.toFloat(Mrgb);
061        
062        // ----------------------------------------------------
063        
064        @Override
065        public float[] getWhitePoint() {
066                return Matrix.toFloat(D65.getXYZ());
067        }
068        
069        @Override
070        public float[] getPrimary(int idx) {
071                return Matrix.toFloat(Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx));
072        }
073        
074        // ----------------------------------------------------
075        
076        /** Constructor (not public). */
077        private sRgbColorSpace() {
078                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
079        }
080        
081        // direct conversion from/to D65-based XYZ space ------------------------------
082        
083        @Override
084        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] xyz65) {
085                float[] rgb = Matrix.multiply(MrgbF, xyz65);    // to linear RGB
086                return GammaMap.applyFwd(rgb);                                  // to non-linear sRGB
087        }
088        
089        @Override
090        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] srgbTHIS) {
091                float[] rgb = GammaMap.applyInv(srgbTHIS);              // to linear rgb
092                return Matrix.multiply(MrgbiF, rgb);    // to XYZ (D65)
093        }
094        
095        // Methods required by ColorSpace (conversion from/to PCS space) ------------------
096
097        // assumes xyz50 is in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space
098        @Override
099        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz50PCS) {
100                float[] xyz65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(xyz50PCS);  // to XYZ (D65)
101                return this.fromCIEXYZ65(xyz65);                                // to sRGB
102        }
103
104        // returned colors are in D50-based CS_CIEXYZ color space 
105        @Override
106        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] srgbTHIS) {
107                float[] xyz65 = this.toCIEXYZ65(srgbTHIS);              // to XYZ (D65)
108                return catD65toD50.applyTo(xyz65);              // to XYZ (D50)
109        }
110        
111        // ----------------------------------------------------
112        
113        @Override // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
114        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
115                return srgb;
116        }
117
118        @Override // no conversion needed, since this is sRGB
119        public float[] toRGB(float[] srgbTHIS) {
120                return srgbTHIS;
121        }
122
123}
